creator: thomas.lawton@green.ox.ac.uk
text:
To reproduce:

1. include '%{set-cookie}o' in logformat
2. serve a page which sets more than one cookie

Behaviour:

 Log includes only the first cookie. I'm told this would apply to any header 
included in the log this way (only first match included - ap_table_get only 
returning first value in the source my friend looked at, which I think was 1.3).

Expected behaviour:

 http://httpd.apache.org/docs/mod/mod_log_config.html

 %...{Foobar}o:  The contents of Foobar: header line(s) in the reply.

 ie includes all lines.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
You've hit an edge case ;-)

Set-Cookie is the only header with a special treatment (i.e. 2+ cookies are sent
as separate headers, because browser don't get it otherwise).
FYI: Fixed in 2.1 and proposed for backport into the stable branches.
creator: nd@perlig.de

text:
Fix was backported in Apache 2.0.56
Closing bug
creator: poirier@pobox.com
